str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
Vehemently, powerfully, vigorously. Adverb from a compound of eu and a derivative of teino; in a well-strung manner, i.e. intensely.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To effectively (utterly) refute. Middle voice from dia and a compound of kata and elegcho; to prove downright, i.e. Confute.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
Public, publicly. From demos; public; in public.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To show, display, point out, indicate; I prove, demonstrate. From epi and deiknuo; to exhibit.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(a) a writing, (b) a passage of scripture; plur: the scriptures. A document, i.e. Holy Writ.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
